text:
- Medtronic is the largest
medical device company
in the world.

We have a technology
that is called PillCam.
Imagine a capsule with two cameras
inside each wall of the capsule
and then these capsules take pictures
of your intestine, your colon.

So there are 22 million
patients in the US only

who should get screened for
colon cancer but they don't.

Reason why is because they
don't wanna get the colonoscopy,
it's an a pleasant procedure.
Imagine this technology being able
to reach millions of patients globally.

So we didn't have an infrastructure
and experience to do so

and scale this technology
across the globe.

Right now, the technology
is sitting on a hardware.
We choose AWS to move all this information
up in the cloud with AWS,

use the cloud also to read
these millions of images
that comes from the patient,

use artificial intelligence
in the same cloud

to spread this information
down to our customers,
because at the end of the day,

the gastroenterologists will
make the final decision,

but with the help of the
cloud, the AWS and the AI,

decision will be faster
and also more reliable.
This collaboration with AWS would allow us

to scale the technology
also in a secure way
because regulatory body across the globe

are very concerned about data
breach and data security.
So one piece that really appreciated

as a collaboration with AWS
has been the holistic approach
that they brought into our project,
not only driven by technical expertise,
but also regulatory, legal, consumer,
thinking out of the box.

So the infrastructure we
have been building with AWS

will allow patients to
have a seamless experience
with our technology

and also provide even a
better clinical outcome.
(light music)
